intro: Nesaea alata, commonly known as the winged nesaea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals and five stamens. Nesaea alata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
